013package org.apache.juneau.internal;
014
015import java.io.*;
016import org.apache.juneau.utils.*;
017
018/**
019 * Various utility methods for creating and working with throwables.
020 */
021public class ThrowableUtils {
022
023   /**
024    * Creates a new {@link RuntimeException}.
025    *
026    * @param cause The caused-by exception.
027    * @return A new {@link RuntimeException}, or the same exception if it's already of that type.
028    */
029   public static RuntimeException asRuntimeException(Throwable cause) {
030      return cast(RuntimeException.class, cause);
031   }
032
033   /**
034    * Casts or wraps the specified throwable to the specified type.
035    *
036    * @param <T> The class to cast to.
037    * @param type The class to cast to.
038    * @param t The throwable to cast.
039    * @return Either the same exception if it's already the specified type, or a wrapped exception.
040    */
041   public static <T> T cast(Class<T> type, Throwable t) {
042      try {
043         return type.isInstance(t) ? type.cast(t) : type.getConstructor(Throwable.class).newInstance(t);
044      } catch (Exception e) {
045         throw new RuntimeException(e);
046      }
047   }
048
049   /**
050    * Same as {@link Throwable#getCause()} but searches the throwable chain for an exception of the specified type.
051    *
052    * @param c The throwable type to search for.
053    * @param <T> The throwable type to search for.
054    * @param t The throwable to search.
055    * @return The exception, or <jk>null</jk> if not found.
056    */
057   public static <T extends Throwable> T getCause(Class<T> c, Throwable t) {
058      while (t != null) {
059         t = t.getCause();
060         if (c.isInstance(t))
061            return c.cast(t);
062      }
063      return null;
064   }
065
066   /**
067    * Allows you to wrap a supplier that throws an exception so that it can be used in a fluent interface.
068    *
069    * @param <T> The supplier type.
070    * @param supplier The supplier throwing an exception.
071    * @return The supplied result.
072    * @throws RuntimeException if supplier threw an exception.
073    */
074   public static <T> T safeSupplier(SupplierWithThrowable<T> supplier) {
075      try {
076         return supplier.get();
077      } catch (RuntimeException t) {
078         throw t;
079      } catch (Throwable t) {
080         throw asRuntimeException(t);
081      }
082   }
083
084   /**
085    * Interface used with {@link #safeSupplier(SupplierWithThrowable)}.
086    */
087   @SuppressWarnings("javadoc")
088   @FunctionalInterface
089   public interface SupplierWithThrowable<T> {
090      public T get() throws Throwable;
091   }
092
093   /**
094    * Runs a snippet of code and encapsulates any throwable inside a {@link RuntimeException}.
095    *
096    * @param snippet The snippet of code to run.
097    */
098   public static void safeRun(Snippet snippet) {
099      try {
100         snippet.run();
101      } catch (RuntimeException t) {
102         throw t;
103      } catch (Throwable t) {
104         throw asRuntimeException(t);
105      }
106   }
107
108   /**
109    * Convenience method for getting a stack trace as a string.
110    *
111    * @param t The throwable to get the stack trace from.
112    * @return The same content that would normally be rendered via <c>t.printStackTrace()</c>
113    */
114   public static String getStackTrace(Throwable t) {
115      StringWriter sw = new StringWriter();
116      try (PrintWriter pw = new PrintWriter(sw)) {
117         t.printStackTrace(pw);
118      }
119      return sw.toString();
120   }
121
122   /**
123    * Calculates a 16-bit hash for the specified throwable based on it's stack trace.
124    *
125    * @param t The throwable to calculate the stack trace on.
126    * @param stopClass Optional stop class on which to stop calculation of a stack trace beyond when found.
127    * @return A calculated hash.
128    */
129   public static int hash(Throwable t, String stopClass) {
130      int i = 0;
131      while (t != null) {
132         for (StackTraceElement e : t.getStackTrace()) {
133            if (e.getClassName().equals(stopClass))
134               break;
135            if (e.getClassName().indexOf('$') == -1)
136               i ^= e.hashCode();
137         }
138         t = t.getCause();
139      }
140      return i;
141   }
142}
